Job Description:
The candidate will assume the role of a Solution Architect in our Enterprise Technology Practice and oversee technical strategy and delivery for our IoT advisory and implementation projects across their lifecycles.
The candidate s scope will include supporting:
Sales/pre-sales activities (understanding client/customer goals and requirements, conceptual solution development, demos, proposal development, work planning, and project approach and work estimates)
Client delivery (defining solutions and architecture that meet client requirements, coaching and management of technical personnel, management of technical tasks and work threads, incorporation of DevOps and other firm and industry standard methods and practices, interfacing and coordinating with client team members, delivering on time and on budget solutions that exceed client expectations)
Firm technical capability development (assisting with hiring and mentoring junior technical resources, contributing to DevOps and technical standards and methods).
This person can be located anywhere in India and will provide solution development and technical delivery leadership to client initiatives in India as needed.
You will work in a client-facing role for established global clientele, helping them apply leading ThingWorx IoT, Advanced Analytics and Augmented Reality capabilities to challenging business problems. Our work is fast-paced, demanding, and provides unparalleled exposure to unique opportunities. The learning curve can be quite steep, but our team will help you build confidence and enable you to explore areas that are of interest to you. Our focus is on helping clients extract business value from cutting edge IoT capabilities, not just on making the technology work. In this role you will help design, develop, and test solutions for a diverse set of clients in industries such as Manufacturing, Life Sciences, High Tech, Consumer Goods and Retail.
The successful candidate will be a member of Kalypso s Enterprise Technology capability and work with and receive coaching and oversight from Senior Regional and Global technology leaders to successfully develop and implement IoT and Digital solutions that meet client needs. In turn, the candidate will also be expected to provide direction, guidance, coaching and training to technical specialists (developers, software engineers, etc.) who are assigned to their client engagements, many of whom will be based in one of Kalypso s Innovation Centers in Pune, IN, Bucharest, RO or Monterrey, MX.
To qualify for our Solution Architect position, you should possess the following:
Experience leading the implementation, validation and deployment of scalable, commercial IoT/IIoT, AR/VR and analytics solutions in a client-facing setting.
Experience supporting sales and pre-sales activities in these domains
Undergraduate degree (preferably in Computer Science or Information Systems with supplementary experience in Data Science and/or Statistics)
Excellent communication skills in English, both written and verbal
Strong academic performance required
Relevant work experience is highly preferred
Superior analytical, technical and problem-solving skills
Effective interpersonal, organizational, and time management skills
Creativity, self-confidence and flexibility
Willingness to travel (required) up to 75%
Solution Architects should possess the following technical and consulting skills:
Experience with the PTC ThingWorx technology stack:
development of IoT applications and solutions including building scalable data model, services, orchestration, system integrations
development of IoT connectivity components utilizing ThingWorx edge SDKs or industrial protocols (OPC, MQTT, MTConnect, ModBus and similar)
Experience in working within manufacturing domain - understanding typical OT and IT components of manufacturing operations, their architectures and data structures: MES, CMMS, PLC, DCS, SCADA, HMI, ERP, Asset Management and similar.
Experience with advanced analytics and machine learning disciplines like model development, training, validation and deployment
Experience integrating ThingWorx with Big Data platforms
Competency in Graph/NoSQL database techniques, and RDBS platforms like Oracle,MS SQL Server, Postgres, InfluxDB
Competency in mathematical disciplines including linear algebra, calculus, probabilistic models and statistics
Data manipulation techniques, including ETL/ETLV
Competency in object-oriented development patterns in Java and .NET
Competency in data analysis applications built in R, Python, Scala
Competency in data visualization platforms like D3.js and Tableau
Competency in modern web development techniques like Angular, Node.js, React, Bootstrap, HTML5 and CSS, Javascript
Competency in modern integration standards like RESTful and OData, message-oriented-middleware (MQ)
Strong UML skills and ability to document structural and behavioral elements of solution architecture
Competency in one of the major cloud platforms such as AWS, Microsoft Azure, GCP, etc.
Experience leading remote development teams, performance testing, unit test, etc.
Strong knowledge and experience in Agile and SDLC software development practices and technical documentation (requirements, functional specifications, test plans, DevOps, test automation etc.)
Understanding of business requirements and the process of translating them into well-engineered and integrated technical solutions; attention to detail
Client-focused to understand and appropriately respond to our clients business needs
Demonstrated ability to interface effectively and collaborate with clients, peers and management to help develop solutions and ensure stakeholder buy-in
Versatility, flexibility and proactivity when resolving technical issues and dealing with ambiguity
Commitment to quality and on-schedule/on-budget delivery; proven ability to establish and meet milestones and deadlines with solutions that meet or exceed client expectations and requirements.
Keywords: ERP, MS SQL, UML, Performance testing, Data structures, Presales, Oracle, Solution Architect, SDLC, Python

Job Description:
The responsibility of the Security Product Manager (PM) is to drive application security strategic projects through R&D aligned with the PTCs ThingWorx IoT business segment, building and maintaining a best-in-class security program
Key areas of focus will include maturing security controls throughout the SDLC, enhancing Identity Access Management (IAM) and Single-Sign-On (SSO) capabilities in the applications, and driving the inclusion of security processes and controls as part of DevSecOps, as well as general security operations, as a critical component of IoT solutions
As a Security PM, you will continue to build up security expertise and industry knowledge to contribute to the remediation of security risks, evangelize security best practices, making security a priority, oversee the rollout of security controls in the SDLC and CI/CD pipeline, and lead strategic security initiated projects across IoT R&D
As a representative of the IoT Product Security team, collaboration and communication are key in driving security forward, working across functional areas
Expectations include a combination of both project management to deliver on complex functional projects, as well as hands-on technical security skills, including knowledge of vulnerability management, secure code development practices (Java and Java Script), threat modeling, and security scanning tools (ie, SAST, DAST, IAST, OSS)
Contributions to the evolving IoT segment s SaaS DevSecOps policies and practices will be a key functionality that is in direct support of the IoT business model
To be successful in this role, the candidate will have a minimum of 5 years of experience working in a Product Security role or as a Product Security Architect, experience in Product Management, clear knowledge of the Secure SDLC, and an understanding of how to integrate security practices into Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) CI/CD pipeline
Candidates currently working in Product Security will be given preference
Your Day-To-Day
Identify security strategic and technical requirements in support of cross-functional implementations, ensuring security is built-in across the application
Own and define strategy and technical requirements for ongoing improvements in IAM/SSO functionality of the ThingWorx platform in coordination with overall PTC products
Threat model complex application architecture deployed on a cloud-based platform (ie, Azure, Kubernetes)
Work directly with Technical Product Managers, including cross-segment dependencies, to oversee major complex security projects/features to ensure on-time delivery, meeting customer requirements and planned release dates,
Participate and contribute to the definition of the secure CI/CD pipeline for IoT SaaS operations (DevSecOps), including incident response, vulnerability management, and continuous delivery mechanisms.
Lead vulnerability risk and severity prioritization and scoring activities across functional teams.
Participate in customer calls to represent IoT security, collaborating and working to address customer security concerns, questions, and requirements.
Provide support to analyze and resolve key security vulnerabilities.
Analyze and recommend strategy and direction to mitigate security risks within the development organization, and continuously improve secure SDLC.
Oversee the rollout of new security controls, scanning tools, and process updates, including metrics
Contribute to critical product security incident response events.
Collaborates in the response to Product Security related inquiries from a variety of internal and external stakeholders.
Collaborate on the definition of product security standards, policies, and processes.
Conduct presentations in the area of cybersecurity to internal and external stakeholders.
Be a Security champion who emphasizes the implications of security gaps and is able to drive decisions by translating technical security requirements into business impact metrics
Cognizant of the market needs laws in the US, EMEA, and APAC regions impacting IoT to continue to strive for improving PTC s overall security posture.
Skills and knowledge:
Product Security leadership experience, based on industry analysis, tools, and standards.
Data driven and strategic Product Management skills.
Strong background in the implementation and maturity of Secure SDLC programs based on at least one industry standard framework (OWASP SAMM, BSIMM, MS SDL).
Experience with security best practices for common authentication protocols (OpenID Connect, OAuth, SAML, LDAP, KERBEROS, etc).
Experience implementing security practices in Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) CI/CD pipeline.
Knowledgeable with application containerization technologies, including Docker image build capabilities, image security validation, image signing, and attack surface reduction.
Knowledge of common security standards and best practices, such as NIST 800-53/800-160, ISO 270xx, CWE, CVSS, OWASP, MITRE ATT&CK, and CERT Secure Coding Standards.
Experience using SAST, DAST, and SCA platforms.
Experience with the secure implementation of OAuth2 Flows: Authorization Code Flow, Client Credentials Flow, Device Code Flow, etc
Security knowledge in the area of enterprise communication protocols and data exchange technologies, eg, AMQP (Advanced Message Queuing Protocol), MQTT, Web Sockets, etc
Experience with Product Security Incident Response.
Basic Qualifications
Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or STEM-related field
Minimum of 5 years working in a Product Security role; Security Manager or Architect
Product Management or strong leadership experience
Good written and verbal communication skills
Keywords: Product management, LDAP, ISO, Coding, Access management, Project management, Application security, application architecture, SDLC

Job Description:
Drive a customer-focused, agile, and fun approach to hardware product management.
Work closely with the director to define, execute, and deliver our IoT and lighting product roadmap in collaboration with our hardware, firmware, and software engineering organizations.
  Represent the broader product strategy to the teams and be a day-to-day contact for user stories and product design matters.
Develop and manage the IoT and lighting control product PL at the portfolio level by working with Marketing, Supply Chain, Customer Success, Hardware, Firmware and Software Engineering, etc. to ensure customer and stakeholder success.
  Assess the competitive landscape and keep up to date on the latest trends to decide when to partner and when to lead with our own innovations.
Be an advocate for simplicity, style, beauty, usability and customer centric design in every product discussion
Measure your success, defining operational metrics for each of your responsibilities through specific KPIs and OKRs.
Collaborate with larger Siemens to scale IoT and lighting solutions globally.

Candidate Profile

You have 3-5 years of core product management experience - envisioning, specifying, and shipping hardware products and solutions (experience in lighting control and IoT products will be an added advantage), overall, 5-10 years of industry experience.
You have a Bachelor or Master of Engineering background. Electrical Engineering major is desirable.
If you have worked with the hardware engineering team in your previous gig, that will be a plus.
  Your experience with Lighting Control, Building Automation, or IoT products/systems a plus.
You operate at warp speed and can drive the pace of the company to its limits.
  You insist on making data driven decisions and driving the team to invest in data to inform future decisions. You can also present the data and customer feedback to internal stakeholders like C-Level executives or engineering teams and external stakeholders like customer advocacy or a focus group.
You are a chess-master with strategy and are always three steps ahead of the competition.
  No detail is too small, you are hands-on, and you have a relentless drive to fit all the intricate details into the big picture.
Demonstrable curiosity about products.
You are passionate with entrepreneurial spirit and a desire to work in a fast-paced environment, where you can take time bound decisive actions.
Willingness to push yourself to learn new things and collaborate with everyone in the organization.
Keywords: Product management, Supply chain, Automation, Analytical, Agile, Siemens, Product design, Firmware, Operations

Job Description:
Salesforce industries goal is to deliver rapid, value-driven customer solutions for complex business problems. Our Salesforce Developers are key players in this objective, as they can leverage native Industry Cloud functionality to deliver customer requirements quickly with minimal customisation.
You'll be responsible for turning the program design of our Solution Architects and Technical Architects into a configured solution that meets the customer's needs.
Working predominantly in Agile scrum teams, you ll be building out complex business processes using Industry Cloud technology and the toolkit of the platform.
You'll be involved in all phases of the project lifecycle - from low-level design and development through to deployment and post-production support.
You'll acquire a deep product knowledge of the Salesforce Industries vertical applications, and will be able to mentor customer (and system integrator) resources and accelerate knowledge transfer to them.
You'll also act as a champion in the wider Salesforce Industries partner ecosystem, sharing best practices, lessons learned, and time-saving techniques.
Minimum Requirements:
5+ years experience working on deployment teams, ideally using Agile development techniques.
Proven track record of successful delivery of customer projects, preferably enterprise CRM implementations.
Experience in building solutions in the financial services industry.
A self-starter, adept at picking up new skills and technologies, and eager to break new ground.
Excellent communication skills, equally comfortable with crafting emails as leading a white-board discussion with customers or delivering a technical presentation.
Vision to help us take our company to the next level.
Degree or equivalent relevant experience required. Experience will be evaluated based on the core competencies for the role (eg extracurricular leadership roles, military experience, volunteer roles, work experience, etc)
Technical Requirements:
Salesforce (Apex, VisualForce, Lightning)
Java, SOAP APIs, REST (JSON, XML)
Data modeling
Process modeling tools and best practices
Preferred Requirements :
Knowledge of OmniStudio (Integration Procedures, Data Raptors, Omniscripts)
Excellent interpersonal and communications skills.
Salesforce Platform Developer / Platform App Builder certification
Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related field
Keywords: Post production, Production support, Data modeling, XML, Agile development, Service marketing, Financial services, Salesforce, CRM

Job Background:
This position is for the IoT RMS System Testing Team of Ingersoll Rand Engineering & Technology Center
The team is responsible for complete end - to - end testing of all the IoT Remote Management System of IR and GD Ingersoll Rand Compressors
The Position is for a Manual/Automation Testing Position for the IoT RMS Project, which is a part of Digital Development Project
This IoT system supports Multiple IR and GD Compressor Controller Applications and the Team is responsible for testing this platform and all the applications
Job Description:
Understand Software / System Requirements and come up with Test Scenarios for testing of Edge Device FW, Controller Application, Web Application and User Interface.
Understanding the Non Functional testing requirements like GUI performance or System devices load performance.
Understanding the Testing and improving the quality of Test Cases by identifying Scenarios / Test cases that can add More Coverage.
Identify Automation possible test cases in Regression suite and come up with Automation solution suggestion and implementation.
Perform feasibility study for Automation by evaluating tools, implementing PoC and improving Automation coverage.
Execution, maintenance and enhancement of Performance Automation solutions.
Supporting the Development team in Identifying Root Cause / Re-testing of Critical Defects to find Effective Resolution.
Performing Project activities for the project and preparing Test Automation Development, Test Report, and Maintaining Test Cases to Latest, Maintaining DFMEA / DVP&R.
Work closely with Global team, coordinate with multiple teams and report out of the status to Global team.
Keywords: System testing, Linux, Talent acquisition, Testing tools, Web testing, Functional testing, Performance testing, Selenium, Test cases, Python

Job Description:
As a Senior Software Engineer in the IoT domain you will be responsible for developing critical systems keeping in mind.
Concurrency: You must handle multiple activities concurrently like fetching and sending multiple messages from/to multiple devices at the same time.
Distributed Operations: You must run on a distributed network of multiple servers in different geographies, coordinating through APIs on a microservices architecture.
Scalability: You must scale horizontally as the traffic grows and leverage on the multiple CPU cores of the servers to run parallel threads.
Responsiveness: You must maintain a strict time-frame of
Reliability: You must stay in continuous operation for years without any server downtime or restarts even for system updates through hot-swapping.
Your Roles and Responsibilities
Design and write programs to improve the availability, scalability, latency, and efficiency of Company s IoT systems.
Work with the engineering team to explore and create new design/architectures geared towards scale and performance.
Work with multiple data ingestion sources and protocols like HTTP, MQTT, CoAP,OPC UA and databases to drive efficient ETL processes for streaming data from IoT sensor devices
Participate in code and design reviews to maintain our high development standards.
Engage in service capacity and demand planning, software performance analysis, tuning and optimization.
Collaborate with product and experience teams to define and prototype feature specifications.
Work closely with the infrastructure team in building and scaling back-end services as well as performing root cause analysis investigations.
Design, build, analyze and fix large-scale distributed systems.
Qualifications
Required Software Aptitude and Qualifications
5+ years of overall software engineering experience.
Programming experience with modern languages such as Ruby/Python/Elixir etc.
You should have good experience working with relational and non-relational databases. We use Postgres and Cassandra.
Good to have but not mandatory working experience with caching tools such as Redis, Queue mechanism setup with RabbitMQ.
Good knowledge of version management with Git.
Awareness of TDD.
CI/CD knowledge would be a huge advantage.
Will to design and maintain large scale distributed systems.
Past experience in building complex applications, either by yourself, or as part of a larger team
Desire (obsessive) for maintainability.
Experience of working with cross-functional remote teams in an Agile software development framework.
Experience in designing APIs with proper documentation.
Ability to write useful and maintainable tests.
Good understanding of the common architectural patterns and design principles.
Solid understanding of how modern web applications work.
Strong written and verbal communications skills in English to engage a variety of large audiences, internally and externally.
Strong analytical and reasoning skills.
Bachelor s Degree or equivalent in any relevant discipline.
Good to have experience with Elixir
It would be amazing if you have some experience working with Elixir Lang.
You should be aware of idiomatic programming in Elixir, and should have good awareness of concepts such as pattern matching, recursion, and behaviours.
You should be well versed with concurrency and processes in Elixir.
You should be hands on with Genservers, Tasks, Agents, Supervisors, and other OTP concepts in Elixir.
Plus points if you have worked with data processing libraries such as Genstage, Flow and Broadway.
Keywords: Rabbitmq, Software Development, Software Developer, Git, Software Engineering, Tdd, Microservices Architecture, Redis, Distributed Systems, Python

Job Description:
Overview
Boeing is the worldÃÂÃÂs largest (Per Boeing LinkedIn page) aerospace company and a leading provider of commercial airplanes, defense, space, and security systems, and global services. Building on a legacy of over a century of innovation and leadership, Boeing continues to lead the way in technology and innovation, customer delivery, and investment in its people and future growth of aerospace.
In India, Boeing has been a strong partner to the Indian aerospace and defense sectors for more than 75 years. People at Boeing have been supporting mission readiness and modernization of IndiaÃÂÃÂs defense forces, and enabling connected, safer, and smarter flying experiences, in the sky, in the seas, and in space.
Technology for today and tomorrow
The Boeing India Engineering & Technology Center (BIETC) is a 3000+ diverse engineering workforce that contributes to global aerospace growth. Our engineers deliver cutting-edge R&D, innovation, and high-quality engineering work in global markets, and leverage new-age technologies such as AI/ML, IIoT, Cloud, Model-Based Engineering, and Additive Manufacturing, shaping the future of aerospace.
People-driven culture
At Boeing, we believe creativity and innovation thrives when every employee is trusted, empowered, and has the flexibility to choose, grow, learn, and explore. We offer variable arrangements depending upon business and customer needs, and professional pursuits that offer greater flexibility in the way our people work. We also believe that collaboration, frequent team engagements, and face-to-face meetings bring diverse perspectives and thoughts ÃÂÃÂ enabling every voice to be heard and every perspective to be respected. No matter where or how our teammates work, we are committed to positively shaping peopleÃÂÃÂs careers and being thoughtful about employee wellbeing.
At Boeing, we are inclusive, diverse, and transformative.
With us, you can create and contribute to what matters most in your career, community, country, and world. Join us in powering the progress of global aerospace.
Boeing India Software Engineering Team is currently looking for a Senior Technical Product Owner to join their team in Bangalore, IN.  Software engineers at Boeing work together to leapfrog the aerospace & defense industry in rapid delivery of innovative, high integrity software solutions.
As a Senior Technical Product Owner for the Digital Transformation of our Factory Floor, you will play a pivotal role in defining the vision, strategy, and execution of our digital initiatives aimed at optimizing production processes, improving efficiency, and driving innovation. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and external partners to deliver transformative solutions that enhance our manufacturing capabilities.
Key Responsibilities:
Product Strategy: Define and communicate a clear product vision and strategy for the digital transformation of the factory floor, aligning it with the broader business goals.
Requirements Gathering: Collaborate with stakeholders, including production teams, engineers, and data analysts, to identify, prioritize, and document requirements for digital transformation projects.
Roadmap Development: Create and maintain a comprehensive product roadmap, outlining key initiatives, timelines, and dependencies.
Team Leadership: Lead and motivate cross-functional teams, including software developers, data scientists, and engineers, to deliver high-quality solutions on time and within budget.
User Stories: Develop and manage detailed user stories, acceptance criteria, and product backlogs, ensuring that they are well-defined and ready for development.
Feature Prioritization: Prioritize features and enhancements based on business value, user needs, and technical feasibility, adapting to changing market conditions.
Technical Expertise: Maintain a deep understanding of digital technologies, automation, IoT, data analytics, and related tools to provide technical guidance to the team.
Risk Management: Identify and address potential risks and issues that could impact project delivery, proactively seeking solutions and mitigation strategies.
Effectively communicate product plans, progress, and updates to stakeholders, fostering transparency and collaboration.
Performance Metrics: Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success and impact of digital transformation initiatives.
Continuous Improvement: Promote a culture of continuous improvement within the organization, seeking opportunities to optimize processes and enhance factory floor operations.
Basic Qualifications:
Education/experience typically acquired through advanced education (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 13+ years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience (e.g. Master + 12 years' related work experience.)
 Proven experience as a Technical Product Owner, Product Manager, or similar role in digital transformation initiatives within manufacturing or related industries.
Strong understanding of manufacturing processes and technologies.
Excellent leadership, communication, and collaboration skills.
Proficiency in Agile methodologies and project management tools.
Analytical mindset with problem-solving capabilities.
Preferred Qualifications:
Relevant certifications in product management, project management, or lean manufacturing.
Experience with Industry 4.0 concepts and technologies.
Knowledge of cybersecurity practices for industrial environments.
Familiarity with machine learning, artificial intelligence, and predictive maintenance.
The Senior Technical Product Owner plays a critical role in driving the success of the product and ensuring that it meets the needs of both customers and the business. This position requires a blend of technical expertise, business acumen, and strong leadership abilities to excel in delivering high-quality products to market.
Relocation:
This position offers relocation based on candidate eligibility.
Keywords: data analytics, analytical, stringing, predictive maintenance, manufacturing processes, digital circuits, machine learning, artificial intelligence, iot, automation, collaboration, leadership, product vision, agile, project management tools, communication skills, agile methodology

Job Description:
The candidate must have a great inclination towards conducting deep rooted research on Embedded/IoT systems/devices in order to uncover the vulnerabilities and methods that can be used to compromise device security.
He/She should have proven credentials in different phases for compromising device security:-
Initial Reconnaissance (Understand product s internal as well as communication mechanism)
Attack Surface Identification - Physical, Wireless, Wired & Web
Threat Modelling (Identification of Actors and Entity Boundary)
Protocol Endpoints - Read/Understand Protocol Specification, Gather Sample Protocol Implementations & Protocol Simulators, Testing with the Simulators and ability to write Scripts to Interact with The device
Firmware Vulnerability Analysis - Firmware Extraction and Analysing Firmware, Vulnerability Analysis, Manual Reversing of Binaries, Understand Firmware Update Process
Hardware Vulnerability Analysis - Identify and analyse Hardware Debug ports, Memory extraction and analysis, Malicious data injection
Manage all facets of Vulnerability Assessment and Penetration testing involving embedded devices.
Perform attacks and identify vulnerabilities on interfaces like USB, WiFi. Ethernet etc.
Expertise/Familiarity with Hardware & Radio Security Testing:-
Data extraction from external flash memory, UART Debug port testing, JTAG Debug port testing, Hardcoded Sensitive information in firmware, sensor manipulation, Bluetooth testing, Zigbee testing, Wi-Fi testing, MQTT testing, Radio testing etc.
What you need:
Minimum Qualifications (Required):
Bachelor s in Software/Electronics Engineering or equivalent degree.
8+ years of hands-on experience in Vulnerability and Penetration Testing using tools like Kali, Nessus, Burpsuite, Qualys etc.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Technical Skills:
Experience in automation of routine tasks using tools like Jenkins and/or scripting languages such as PowerShell, Ruby or Python.
Understanding of Cloud based environments like Azure and AWS.

Must be flexible, independent and self-motivated.

Job Description:
As an IoT Engineer specializing in the water sector, your primary responsibility is to bridge the gap between technical expertise and effective sales communication. You will be tasked with
understanding and presenting the technical aspects of IoT solutions tailored for the water sector to potential clients, facilitating technical discussions, and supporting the sales team in achieving revenue targets. Your role will encompass both technical expertise and excellent communication skills to effectively convey complex concepts to clients in the water industr

Role & responsibilities
1. Technical Expertise:
Understand and stay updated on IoT technologies, protocols, and solutions relevant to the water sector.
Develop a deep understanding of IoT devices, sensors, data analytics, and software platforms specific to water management and monitoring.
Solution Design and Customization:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design IoT solutions that meet the unique needs of water- related applications.
Customize IoT solutions based on client requirements, ensuring optimal performance and integration with existing systems.
2. Technical Presentations and Demonstrations:
Develop and deliver engaging technical presentations to potential clients, showcasing the capabilities and benefits of IoT solutions for the water sector.
Conduct live demonstrations to illustrate the functionalities and advantages of the proposed IoT solutions.
3. Client Consultations:
Engage in technical discussions with clients to understand their specific water management challenges and requirements.
Provide expert advice and guidance on how IoT solutions can address their challenges and improve operational efficiency.
4. Collaboration and Support:
Collaborate with the sales team to prepare technical proposals and tender responses, ensuring alignment with client needs and expectations.
Act as a technical resource during the sales process, providing clarification and addressing technical inquiries from clients.
5. Market Research and Analysis:
Stay informed about industry trends, competitive landscape, and emerging technologies in the water sector.
Use market insights to identify opportunities for product enhancements and potential new offerings.
6. Training and Education:
Conduct training sessions for internal teams, clients, and partners to enhance their understanding of IoT solutions in the water sector.
Support knowledge transfer and skill development within the organization.

Preferred candidate profile
a. Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Electronics Communication Engineering, or a related field.
b. 4 to 7 years of relevant experience in IoT, water management, or a related technical role.
c. Strong technical aptitude and understanding of IoT protocols, devices, and software platforms.
d. Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
e. Sales or customer-facing experience is a plus.
f. This role requires a blend of technical knowledge, sales acumen, and effective communication to drive successful IoT solution implementations within the water sector. The IoT Engineer will play a pivotal role in enabling the adoption of cutting-edge technology to optimize water management processes.
Keywords: Water, IoT Engineer, Iot Application Development, water sector, Water System, water management, Water Treatment Plant, Water Supply, Water Treatment, IOT

Job Description:
As an IoT (Internet of Things) Developer, your role revolves around designing, developing, and implementing IoT solutions that connect devices, sensors, and systems to the Internet or other networks.

Responsibilities
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand project requirements and design end-to-end IoT solutions. This involves selecting appropriate hardware, communication protocols, and cloud platforms based on the use case.
Develop software for embedded systems and IoT devices. Use programming languages such as C, C++, Python, or JavaScript to program micro-controllers and sensors.
IoT Platform Integration: Integrate IoT devices and sensors with cloud platforms and IoT platforms. This includes setting up device connectivity, data ingestion, and authentication mechanisms.
Communication Protocols: Implement communication protocols such as MQTT, CoAP, or HTTP to facilitate data transmission between devices and backend systems.
Data Management: Design data storage and management strategies for handling data generated by IoT devices. Utilize databases, time-series databases, or cloud storage solutions for data retention and analysis.
Security and Privacy: Implement security measures to protect data and devices from unauthorized access and cyber threats. Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations.
Device Management: Develop device management solutions to monitor remotely and control IoT devices. This includes OTA (Over-The-Air) updates and device monitoring functionalities.
Data Analytics and Visualization: Process and analyze IoT data to derive meaningful insights. Create visualizations and dashboards to present data in a user-friendly manner.
Edge Computing: Implement edge computing techniques to perform data processing and analysis closer to the data source, reducing latency and optimizing bandwidth usage.
Testing and Validation: Conduct thorough testing of IoT solutions to ensure the reliability, performance, and interoperability of devices and systems.
Integration with External Systems: Integrate IoT solutions with other enterprise systems, applications, or APIs to enable seamless data exchange and interoperability.


Requirements
Proficiency in programming languages such as C, C++, Python, or JavaScript.
Experience with embedded systems and IoT device programming.
Knowledge of communication protocols and standards used in IoT, such as MQTT, CoAP, and HTTP.
Familiarity with cloud platforms and IoT platforms like AWS IoT, Azure IoT, or Google Cloud IoT.
Understanding of data storage, databases, and data management in IoT applications.
Security knowledge to implement secure communication and protect IoT devices and data.
Experience with data analytics tools and visualization libraries for IoT data analysis.
Familiarity with edge computing concepts and implementation.
Problem-solving and analytical skills to address complex IoT challenges.
Keywords: IT services, SAN, C++, Data analysis, Data management, Javascript, SMS, HTTP, CRM, Python

Job Description:
Responsible for designing, developing, and implementing IoT systems and solutions that connect physical devices to the internet and enable them to communicate with each other and with the cloud. The job description of an IoT Engineer typically includes the following:
System Architecture: Designing and developing the system architecture for IoT solutions, including hardware and software components, communication protocols, and cloud infrastructure.
Hardware Design: Developing the hardware components of the IoT system, such as sensors, actuators, and microcontrollers, and integrating them with the software components.
Software Development: Developing the software components of the IoT system, such as firmware, middleware, and applications, and ensuring that they are secure, scalable, and reliable.
Data Management: Designing and implementing data management systems that can collect, store, and analyze the data generated by IoT devices.
Testing and Validation: Testing and validating the IoT system to ensure that it meets the requirements and specifications of the project.
Maintenance and Support: Providing maintenance and support services for the IoT system, including troubleshooting, bug fixing, and software updates.
Keywords: IoT Engineer, engineer

Job Description:
System Design: Define the overall architecture and design of IoT systems, including hardware, software, networks, and data storage
Consider factors such as scalability, interoperability, and security
Technology Evaluation: Identify and evaluate IoT technologies, protocols, and platforms that best fit the requirements of the project or organization
This may include sensors, communication protocols (eg, MQTT, CoAP), cloud services, and edge computing solutions
Security: Develop robust security strategies and measures to protect IoT devices, data, and communication channels
Address issues related to data privacy, authentication, access control, and device management
Data Management: Define data collection, storage, and processing strategies for IoT-generated data
Ensure that data is effectively managed, analyzed, and used to derive actionable insights
Interoperability: Ensure that IoT devices and systems can communicate and work seamlessly with each other, regardless of the manufacturer or technology used
Promote the use of industry standards and open protocols
Scalability: Design IoT systems to be scalable, allowing for the addition of more devices and increased data volume as the IoT deployment grows
Edge Computing: Incorporate edge computing principles when necessary to process data closer to the source, reducing latency and enhancing real-time decision-making
Cloud Integration: Determine the role of cloud computing in the IoT ecosystem
Select and integrate cloud services for data storage, analytics, and remote device management
Prototyping and Testing: Develop prototypes and conduct testing to validate the feasibility and functionality of IoT solutions
Iteratively refine designs based on test results
Keywords: Architect

Job Description:
Hi,

Greeting from TCS....!!

We have opening for IOT Vehicle Telematics Solution Developer for Bangalore Location.

Experience: 7-13 Years

Job Description
IOT Telematics will work with a team of software engineers to turn those capabilities into software solutions in Vehicle Telematics solution within AWS environment.
Key Responsibilities
1. Develop and implement Solution using AWS PaaS services to analyze and model and predict engine and power dynamics in various contexts, contributing to the Engine Fault Code and Heartbeat Codes.
2. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify data requirements, extract relevant data sets, and preprocess data for use in machine learning models, ensuring data integrity and quality.
3. Utilize AWS PaaS services, Compute and storage services, Streaming services like Kinesis, Firehose etc.
5. Work closely with domain experts to translate insights from Engine Analytics service module into actionable recommendations for the enhancement of product design, efficiency, and performance.
6. Maintain a comprehensive understanding of the latest advancements and best practices in Vehicle Telematics platform.
7. Collaborate with the IT infrastructure team to ensure the seamless integration and deployment of machine learning models within the Azure environment, adhering to security and compliance protocols.
8. Provide technical guidance and support to the broader engineering team on the implementation and interpretation of machine learning results, fostering a culture of data-driven decision-making.
Qualifications
1. Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, or a related field.
2. Minimum of 8+ years of professional experience in developing and deploying Vehicle Telematics Platform, preferably with a focus on Commercial automotive engines.
3. Strong proficiency in utilizing AWS services for including Lambda, IOT Core, storage and integration services
4. Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java or similar languages commonly used in Vehicle Telematics environment.
7. Familiarity with version control systems, such as Git, and experience collaborating within a team using these tools.
8. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders effectively.


Interested candidates can apply with your attached resume.
Keywords: Aws Iot Core, vehicle telematics, AWS Paas, Aws Lambda, Kinesis, GIT, Firehose, Python

Job Title: Full Stack Senior Software Developer: R&D - IoT & Cloud
Job Description:
We are forming a passionate group of solution innovators, UX devotees, techies, data scientists/AI experts, software lovers, AR/VR experts, visual artists, and architects, working in a lean startup concept. We strive to solve complex problems in various domains ranging from industry, energy, mobility and buildings to smart cities by applying methods and principles of data analytics, artificial intelligence, simulations, and interactive visualization. We are looking for equally passionate techies to join us in this exciting journey of finding solutions to some non-trivial challenges of the always connected peta-byte world.
What are my responsibilities?
You will be responsible for Design of software solutions based on requirements and within the constraints of architectural /design guidelines.
You will have to derive software requirements and software functional specification, validate software requirements, provide software feasibility analysis and software effort estimation.
You should identify potential harmony and for re-use of components / technology.
You will be responsible for the accurate translation of software architecture into design and code.
You will guide Scrum team members on all design topics & implementation consistency against the design/architecture
You will be involved in coding of features and/or bug-fixing and delivering solutions adhering to coding and quality guidelines, for self-owned components
You will guide the team in test automation design and towards implementation of the same
You will be collaborating with globally located teams.
You will participate in resolution of field problems in application of existing products.
What does it take me to qualify for this job?
Masters/Bachelor s degree in Computer Science or related discipline from a reputed institute.
Grass-root experience of 4 - 8 years in solving complex problems and developing end to end application stack.
Solid knowledge in at least one major programming language and computing platform viz. Typescript / JS / Python / Java / Go.
Solid knowledge of either front-end technology viz. Angular/React/Vue, Bootstrap, HTML/CSS/JS.
You should have experience in REST API/GraphQL development with technologies like Express & NodeJS / Flask & Python.

Job Title: Senior Java Software Engineer - IOT and DE
Job Description:
Senior Software Engineer (SSE) IOT & DE

Azuga Telematics is actively seeking a Senior Software Engineer who possesses a solid grounding in Java (preferably Java-17), Spring Boot, and related technologies. The role requires expertise in managing data streams via Kafka and ActiveMQ, along with knowledge in MySQL, Mongo DB,and the AWS cloud platform. A foundation in IoT and MQTT will be highly regarded.
Additionally, proficiency in containerization technologies will be beneficial for this position.

Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and deploy high-quality software solutions using Java (preferably Java-17) and Spring Boot.
Manage and integrate data streams using Kafka and ActiveMQ. Design and maintain database systems in MySQL and MongoDB.
Collaborate with various teams, ensuring seamless integration of applications and systems.
Deploy and oversee applications in the AWS ecosystem with a focus on security, scalability, and reliability.
Leverage IoT and MQTT protocols to augment system capabilities. Review, optimize, and maintain code to ensure performance and scalability.
Mentor junior team members, imparting knowledge and industry best practices. Remain updated on technological advancements and industry trends.
Debug and resolve software defects efficiently.
Handle containerized applications using technologies like Docker, Kubernetes, and Consul.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or a related discipline. Significant experience in Java, particularly Java-17.
Demonstrated expertise in the Spring Boot framework. Hands-on experience with Kafka and ActiveMQ. Proficient in MySQL and MongoDB databases.
Expertise in deploying and managing applications on AWS. A background in IoT and MQTT protocols.
Familiarity with containerization tools,notably Docker, Kubernetes, and Consul. Exceptional problem-solving abilities and analytical prowess.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal. Ability to thrive in both team and individual settings.
Desirable (but not essential):

Certifications related to Java, Spring, AWS or containerization technologies. Familiarity with other cloud platforms.
Experience in agile development methodologies. Knowledge of DevOps tools and CI/CD practices.

How to Apply:

Potential candidates should forward their updated CV, accompanied by a cover letter, to recruitment@azuga.com,with the subject line reading

About Azuga Telematics:

Owned by the renowned Bridgestone Corporation, Azuga Telematics stands at the forefront
of fleet management, underpinned by a culture of innovation. We are deeply rooted in the realms of IoT, broad-scale data collection, analytics, and data science.
Our commitment to pioneering advancements allows us to offer unparalleled services to our clientele. At Azuga, we understand the intricacies of managing vast fleets and employing state-of-the-art technology and insights to drive efficiency, safety, and optimization in every facet of fleet operations.
Keywords: MQTT, Java, AWS, IOT, MySQL, Kafka

Job Description:
IoT Solution Development: Collaborate with the IoT team to design, develop, and implement IoT solutions using Raspberry Pi devices. This involves programming in languages such as Python and utilizing relevant libraries to interact with sensors, actuators, and other peripherals.
Sensor Integration: Work on integrating various sensors and input devices (such as temperature sensors, motion detectors, cameras, etc.) with Raspberry Pi to collect data from the physical environment.
Data Processing: Develop code to process and analyze data collected from sensors, applying relevant algorithms for tasks like data filtering, feature extraction, and basic analytics.
Communication Protocols: Implement communication protocols (such as MQTT, HTTP, or custom protocols) to enable data transmission between Raspberry Pi devices and remote servers/cloud platforms.
Cloud Integration: Collaborate with the team to connect Raspberry Pi devices to cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud), allowing remote monitoring, management, and data storage.
User Interface: Contribute to the development of user interfaces or dashboards that display real-time and historical data from IoT devices, providing insights to users.
Troubleshooting and Debugging: Identify and resolve hardware and software issues that may arise during the development and testing phases.
Documentation: Document your work thoroughly, including code comments, project specifications, and user guides, to ensure knowledge transfer and maintainable projects."

- Interfacing Raspberry Pi to USB NFC Reader
Keywords: Raspberry Pi, python, data processing, http, Raspberry pi programming, aws, iot, azure, Google Cloud

Job Description:
As a Technical Project Manager (TPM), you will architect and deliver an Internet of Things (IoT) solution on the Ayla Platform that is comprised of embedded software, cloud, and mobile apps. You will guide clients and vendors on how to use and extend our solution using APIs and the latest voice features from Amazon and Google. You will handle the day-to-day technical issues that arise during deployment and implement controls to keep the project on track. Finally, you will own the client relationship and vision for maximizing the value of the Ayla solution.
Because of their strong technical background, TPMs aren t intimidated when confronted with a challenge. They have confidence they can bridge knowledge gaps through independent research and learning from others.
Often the challenge is how to balance competing critical items. The TPM s experience allow s them to identify interdependencies so that work is executed as efficiently and flawlessly as possible.
What You ll Achieve in 3 Months
Complete Ayla product training to thoroughly understand the Ayla Platform and serve as our expert in our IoT delivery methodology
Learn our processes for booking and revenue recognition, staffing and resourcing, partner engagement, and engagement from kickoff to closure
Own the staffing and execution of your projects
What You ll Achieve in 12 Months
Launch at least two connected products into the market
Demonstrate your strategic value by expansion with an existing customer and assisting in sales activities
Optimize and enhance our IoT delivery methodology
Key Responsibilities
Be an expert on how the Ayla solution should be delivered via planning, well-defined requirements, risk management, and project governance best practices
Define the solution architecture across the key areas of embedded software, cloud, mobile apps, and integrations with platforms like Amazon Alexa
Research, triage, escalate, and drive-to-resolution technical issues with our engineering teams
Effectively manage competing priorities between Ayla, customer, and vendors
Educate customers on our product whether via presentations or documentation
Desired Skills and Experience
Prior experience with embedded processors, Linux, and languages such as Python, JavaScript, Node.js, C, or Java
Experience with protocols such as BLE, Wi-Fi, TCP/IP, ZigBee, Z-Wave
5+ years experience as a Customer Architect, Sales Engineer, or Technical Consultant with proven ability to deliver high-tech projects across multiple time zones in IoT, SaaS, PaaS, Mobile, or Security
Enterprise or Telco experience is a plus
Keywords: Embedded Software, Java, Linux, Node . Js, Javascript, Client Relationship, Risk Management, Python, Professional Services

About You
First and foremost, we are looking for passionate developers: people who love writing great code and have the drive to become better and better over time. We need people who are self-starters and have a drive to meaningfully impact our continually improving product suite.

Job Description:
The candidate will assume the role of a Solution Architect in our Enterprise Technology Practice and oversee technical strategy and delivery for our IoT advisory and implementation projects across their lifecycles.
The candidate s scope will include supporting:
Sales/pre-sales activities (understanding client/customer goals and requirements, conceptual solution development, demos, proposal development, work planning, and project approach and work estimates)
Client delivery (defining solutions and architecture that meet client requirements, coaching and management of technical personnel, management of technical tasks and work threads, incorporation of DevOps and other firm and industry standard methods and practices, interfacing and coordinating with client team members, delivering on time and on budget solutions that exceed client expectations)
Firm technical capability development (assisting with hiring and mentoring junior technical resources, contributing to DevOps and technical standards and methods).
This person can be located anywhere in India and will provide solution development and technical delivery leadership to client initiatives in India as needed.
You will work in a client-facing role for established global clientele, helping them apply leading ThingWorx IoT, Advanced Analytics and Augmented Reality capabilities to challenging business problems. Our work is fast-paced, demanding, and provides unparalleled exposure to unique opportunities. The learning curve can be quite steep, but our team will help you build confidence and enable you to explore areas that are of interest to you. Our focus is on helping clients extract business value from cutting edge IoT capabilities, not just on making the technology work. In this role you will help design, develop, and test solutions for a diverse set of clients in industries such as Manufacturing, Life Sciences, High Tech, Consumer Goods and Retail.
The successful candidate will be a member of Kalypso s Enterprise Technology capability and work with and receive coaching and oversight from Senior Regional and Global technology leaders to successfully develop and implement IoT and Digital solutions that meet client needs. In turn, the candidate will also be expected to provide direction, guidance, coaching and training to technical specialists (developers, software engineers, etc.) who are assigned to their client engagements, many of whom will be based in one of Kalypso s Innovation Centers in Pune, IN, Bucharest, RO or Monterrey, MX.
To qualify for our Solution Architect position, you should possess the following:
Experience leading the implementation, validation and deployment of scalable, commercial IoT/IIoT, AR/VR and analytics solutions in a client-facing setting.
Experience supporting sales and pre-sales activities in these domains
Undergraduate degree (preferably in Computer Science or Information Systems with supplementary experience in Data Science and/or Statistics)
Excellent communication skills in English, both written and verbal
Strong academic performance required
Relevant work experience is highly preferred
Superior analytical, technical and problem-solving skills
Effective interpersonal, organizational, and time management skills
Creativity, self-confidence and flexibility
Willingness to travel (required) up to 75%
Solution Architects should possess the following technical and consulting skills:
Experience with the PTC ThingWorx technology stack:
development of IoT applications and solutions including building scalable data model, services, orchestration, system integrations
development of IoT connectivity components utilizing ThingWorx edge SDKs or industrial protocols (OPC, MQTT, MTConnect, ModBus and similar)
Experience in working within manufacturing domain - understanding typical OT and IT components of manufacturing operations, their architectures and data structures: MES, CMMS, PLC, DCS, SCADA, HMI, ERP, Asset Management and similar.
Experience with advanced analytics and machine learning disciplines like model development, training, validation and deployment
Experience integrating ThingWorx with Big Data platforms
Competency in Graph/NoSQL database techniques, and RDBS platforms like Oracle,MS SQL Server, Postgres, InfluxDB
Competency in mathematical disciplines including linear algebra, calculus, probabilistic models and statistics
Data manipulation techniques, including ETL/ETLV
Competency in object-oriented development patterns in Java and .NET
Competency in data analysis applications built in R, Python, Scala
Competency in data visualization platforms like D3.js and Tableau
Competency in modern web development techniques like Angular, Node.js, React, Bootstrap, HTML5 and CSS, Javascript
Competency in modern integration standards like RESTful and OData, message-oriented-middleware (MQ)
Strong UML skills and ability to document structural and behavioral elements of solution architecture
Competency in one of the major cloud platforms such as AWS, Microsoft Azure, GCP, etc.
Experience leading remote development teams, performance testing, unit test, etc.
Strong knowledge and experience in Agile and SDLC software development practices and technical documentation (requirements, functional specifications, test plans, DevOps, test automation etc.)
Understanding of business requirements and the process of translating them into well-engineered and integrated technical solutions; attention to detail
Client-focused to understand and appropriately respond to our clients business needs
Demonstrated ability to interface effectively and collaborate with clients, peers and management to help develop solutions and ensure stakeholder buy-in
Versatility, flexibility and proactivity when resolving technical issues and dealing with ambiguity
Commitment to quality and on-schedule/on-budget delivery; proven ability to establish and meet milestones and deadlines with solutions that meet or exceed client expectations and requirements.
Keywords: ERP, MS SQL, UML, Performance testing, Data structures, Presales, Oracle, Solution Architect, SDLC, Python

Job Description:
The responsibility of the Security Product Manager (PM) is to drive application security strategic projects through R&D aligned with the PTCs ThingWorx IoT business segment, building and maintaining a best-in-class security program
Key areas of focus will include maturing security controls throughout the SDLC, enhancing Identity Access Management (IAM) and Single-Sign-On (SSO) capabilities in the applications, and driving the inclusion of security processes and controls as part of DevSecOps, as well as general security operations, as a critical component of IoT solutions
As a Security PM, you will continue to build up security expertise and industry knowledge to contribute to the remediation of security risks, evangelize security best practices, making security a priority, oversee the rollout of security controls in the SDLC and CI/CD pipeline, and lead strategic security initiated projects across IoT R&D
As a representative of the IoT Product Security team, collaboration and communication are key in driving security forward, working across functional areas
Expectations include a combination of both project management to deliver on complex functional projects, as well as hands-on technical security skills, including knowledge of vulnerability management, secure code development practices (Java and Java Script), threat modeling, and security scanning tools (ie, SAST, DAST, IAST, OSS)
Contributions to the evolving IoT segment s SaaS DevSecOps policies and practices will be a key functionality that is in direct support of the IoT business model
To be successful in this role, the candidate will have a minimum of 5 years of experience working in a Product Security role or as a Product Security Architect, experience in Product Management, clear knowledge of the Secure SDLC, and an understanding of how to integrate security practices into Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) CI/CD pipeline
Candidates currently working in Product Security will be given preference
Your Day-To-Day
Identify security strategic and technical requirements in support of cross-functional implementations, ensuring security is built-in across the application
Own and define strategy and technical requirements for ongoing improvements in IAM/SSO functionality of the ThingWorx platform in coordination with overall PTC products
Threat model complex application architecture deployed on a cloud-based platform (ie, Azure, Kubernetes)
Work directly with Technical Product Managers, including cross-segment dependencies, to oversee major complex security projects/features to ensure on-time delivery, meeting customer requirements and planned release dates,
Participate and contribute to the definition of the secure CI/CD pipeline for IoT SaaS operations (DevSecOps), including incident response, vulnerability management, and continuous delivery mechanisms.
Lead vulnerability risk and severity prioritization and scoring activities across functional teams.
Participate in customer calls to represent IoT security, collaborating and working to address customer security concerns, questions, and requirements.
Provide support to analyze and resolve key security vulnerabilities.
Analyze and recommend strategy and direction to mitigate security risks within the development organization, and continuously improve secure SDLC.
Oversee the rollout of new security controls, scanning tools, and process updates, including metrics
Contribute to critical product security incident response events.
Collaborates in the response to Product Security related inquiries from a variety of internal and external stakeholders.
Collaborate on the definition of product security standards, policies, and processes.
Conduct presentations in the area of cybersecurity to internal and external stakeholders.
Be a Security champion who emphasizes the implications of security gaps and is able to drive decisions by translating technical security requirements into business impact metrics
Cognizant of the market needs laws in the US, EMEA, and APAC regions impacting IoT to continue to strive for improving PTC s overall security posture.
Skills and knowledge:
Product Security leadership experience, based on industry analysis, tools, and standards.
Data driven and strategic Product Management skills.
Strong background in the implementation and maturity of Secure SDLC programs based on at least one industry standard framework (OWASP SAMM, BSIMM, MS SDL).
Experience with security best practices for common authentication protocols (OpenID Connect, OAuth, SAML, LDAP, KERBEROS, etc).
Experience implementing security practices in Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) CI/CD pipeline.
Knowledgeable with application containerization technologies, including Docker image build capabilities, image security validation, image signing, and attack surface reduction.
Knowledge of common security standards and best practices, such as NIST 800-53/800-160, ISO 270xx, CWE, CVSS, OWASP, MITRE ATT&CK, and CERT Secure Coding Standards.
Experience using SAST, DAST, and SCA platforms.
Experience with the secure implementation of OAuth2 Flows: Authorization Code Flow, Client Credentials Flow, Device Code Flow, etc
Security knowledge in the area of enterprise communication protocols and data exchange technologies, eg, AMQP (Advanced Message Queuing Protocol), MQTT, Web Sockets, etc
Experience with Product Security Incident Response.
Basic Qualifications
Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or STEM-related field
Minimum of 5 years working in a Product Security role; Security Manager or Architect
Product Management or strong leadership experience
Good written and verbal communication skills
Keywords: Product management, LDAP, ISO, Coding, Access management, Project management, Application security, application architecture, SDLC

Job Description:
Drive a customer-focused, agile, and fun approach to hardware product management.
Work closely with the director to define, execute, and deliver our IoT and lighting product roadmap in collaboration with our hardware, firmware, and software engineering organizations.
  Represent the broader product strategy to the teams and be a day-to-day contact for user stories and product design matters.
Develop and manage the IoT and lighting control product PL at the portfolio level by working with Marketing, Supply Chain, Customer Success, Hardware, Firmware and Software Engineering, etc. to ensure customer and stakeholder success.
  Assess the competitive landscape and keep up to date on the latest trends to decide when to partner and when to lead with our own innovations.
Be an advocate for simplicity, style, beauty, usability and customer centric design in every product discussion
Measure your success, defining operational metrics for each of your responsibilities through specific KPIs and OKRs.
Collaborate with larger Siemens to scale IoT and lighting solutions globally.

Candidate Profile

You have 3-5 years of core product management experience - envisioning, specifying, and shipping hardware products and solutions (experience in lighting control and IoT products will be an added advantage), overall, 5-10 years of industry experience.
You have a Bachelor or Master of Engineering background. Electrical Engineering major is desirable.
If you have worked with the hardware engineering team in your previous gig, that will be a plus.
  Your experience with Lighting Control, Building Automation, or IoT products/systems a plus.
You operate at warp speed and can drive the pace of the company to its limits.
  You insist on making data driven decisions and driving the team to invest in data to inform future decisions. You can also present the data and customer feedback to internal stakeholders like C-Level executives or engineering teams and external stakeholders like customer advocacy or a focus group.
You are a chess-master with strategy and are always three steps ahead of the competition.
  No detail is too small, you are hands-on, and you have a relentless drive to fit all the intricate details into the big picture.
Demonstrable curiosity about products.
You are passionate with entrepreneurial spirit and a desire to work in a fast-paced environment, where you can take time bound decisive actions.
Willingness to push yourself to learn new things and collaborate with everyone in the organization.
Keywords: Product management, Supply chain, Automation, Analytical, Agile, Siemens, Product design, Firmware, Operations

Job Description:
Salesforce industries goal is to deliver rapid, value-driven customer solutions for complex business problems. Our Salesforce Developers are key players in this objective, as they can leverage native Industry Cloud functionality to deliver customer requirements quickly with minimal customisation.

Working predominantly in Agile scrum teams, you ll be building out complex business processes using Industry Cloud technology and the toolkit of the platform.
You'll be involved in all phases of the project lifecycle - from low-level design and development through to deployment and post-production support.
You'll acquire a deep product knowledge of the Salesforce Industries vertical applications, and will be able to mentor customer (and system integrator) resources and accelerate knowledge transfer to them.
You'll also act as a champion in the wider Salesforce Industries partner ecosystem, sharing best practices, lessons learned, and time-saving techniques.

5+ years experience working on deployment teams, ideally using Agile development techniques.

Experience in building solutions in the financial services industry.
A self-starter, adept at picking up new skills and technologies, and eager to break new ground.
Excellent communication skills, equally comfortable with crafting emails as leading a white-board discussion with customers or delivering a technical presentation.
Vision to help us take our company to the next level.
Degree or equivalent relevant experience required. Experience will be evaluated based on the core competencies for the role (eg extracurricular leadership roles, military experience, volunteer roles, work experience, etc)
Technical Requirements:
Salesforce (Apex, VisualForce, Lightning)
Java, SOAP APIs, REST (JSON, XML)
Data modeling
Process modeling tools and best practices
Preferred Requirements :
Knowledge of OmniStudio (Integration Procedures, Data Raptors, Omniscripts)
Excellent interpersonal and communications skills.
Salesforce Platform Developer / Platform App Builder certification
Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related field

Job Description:
Job Title: IoT Engineer
Job Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled IoT Engineer to join our team. As an IoT Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and testing sensors and related software and hardware applications to enhance our products. Your work will enable data transmission, storage, and analysis, contributing to our company's goals and product development. You will be a vital part of our research and development efforts, ensuring the readiness of our products for the market and advancing algorithm development through data analysis. Additionally, you will be responsible for ensuring that all data and technology are compatible with cloud systems.
Key Responsibilities:
Sensor Design and Development:
Design, code, and test sensors that are integrated into our products to collect and transmit data.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand product requirements and translate them into sensor design specifications.
Software and Hardware Development:
Develop and test software and hardware applications that support the functionality of IoT devices and sensors.
Work on firmware development for sensors and IoT devices, ensuring their reliability and performance.
Research and Development:
Participate in product research and development initiatives to drive innovation and improve our product offerings.
Stay updated on emerging IoT technologies and trends to ensure our products remain competitive in the market.
Data Analysis:
Analyze data collected by sensors to identify patterns and insights that can be used to further develop algorithms and improve product performance.
Cloud Compatibility:
Ensure that all data and technology components are compatible with cloud platforms, enabling efficient data storage, retrieval, and analysis.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven experience in IoT sensor design, firmware development, and data analysis.
Proficiency in programming languages such as C/C++, Python, or Java.
Strong knowledge of hardware and software integration for IoT devices.
Familiarity with cloud platforms and IoT protocols (e.g., MQTT, CoAP).
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Effective communication and teamwork skills.
If you are a passionate IoT Engineer with a drive to innovate and enhance products through the power of data and connectivity, we encourage you to apply. Join our team and help us shape the future of IoT technology and its applications.
About ZunRoof: ZunRoof is a home-tech company, powered by a mix of Image Processing, Virtual Reality, IOT and Data Analytics. They are solving energy issues of India by using un-utilized rooftops for solar, and by providing sense and control of every appliance in ones house through inhouse developed IoT-enabled hardware and accompanying apps. The company was founded in June 2016 by Pranesh Chaudhary and Sushant Sachan, both alumni of IIT- Kharagpur. In four years of starting up, ZunRoof has already become the #1 choice for residential and SME clients in India for solar. Till date, the company has assessed lakhs of homes, and has installed 15 MW+ of rooftop solar & 50,000+ IoT devices across 75+ cities in India.
To know more about us refer:
 https://www.zunroof.com/
 https://www.zunpulse.com/
https://www.zunsolar.com/
 https://zunpure.com/
Keywords: Embedded Software, Embedded C++, Embedded C, C++, Embedded Programming, Mqtt, Java, Python

Job Description:
Responsible for designing, developing, and implementing IoT systems and solutions that connect physical devices to the internet and enable them to communicate with each other and with the cloud. The job description of an IoT Engineer typically includes the following:
System Architecture: Designing and developing the system architecture for IoT solutions, including hardware and software components, communication protocols, and cloud infrastructure.
Hardware Design: Developing the hardware components of the IoT system, such as sensors, actuators, and microcontrollers, and integrating them with the software components.
Software Development: Developing the software components of the IoT system, such as firmware, middleware, and applications, and ensuring that they are secure, scalable, and reliable.
Data Management: Designing and implementing data management systems that can collect, store, and analyze the data generated by IoT devices.
Testing and Validation: Testing and validating the IoT system to ensure that it meets the requirements and specifications of the project.
Maintenance and Support: Providing maintenance and support services for the IoT system, including troubleshooting, bug fixing, and software updates.
Keywords: Estimator, HR

raspberry pi software development for different scenarios as per requirement.

Job Description:
Job Title: IoT Engineer
Job Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled IoT Engineer to join our team. As an IoT Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and testing sensors and related software and hardware applications to enhance our products. Your work will enable data transmission, storage, and analysis, contributing to our company's goals and product development. You will be a vital part of our research and development efforts, ensuring the readiness of our products for the market and advancing algorithm development through data analysis. Additionally, you will be responsible for ensuring that all data and technology are compatible with cloud systems.
Key Responsibilities:
Sensor Design and Development:
Design, code, and test sensors that are integrated into our products to collect and transmit data.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand product requirements and translate them into sensor design specifications.
Software and Hardware Development:
Develop and test software and hardware applications that support the functionality of IoT devices and sensors.
Work on firmware development for sensors and IoT devices, ensuring their reliability and performance.
Research and Development:
Participate in product research and development initiatives to drive innovation and improve our product offerings.
Stay updated on emerging IoT technologies and trends to ensure our products remain competitive in the market.
Data Analysis:
Analyze data collected by sensors to identify patterns and insights that can be used to further develop algorithms and improve product performance.
Cloud Compatibility:
Ensure that all data and technology components are compatible with cloud platforms, enabling efficient data storage, retrieval, and analysis.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven experience in IoT sensor design, firmware development, and data analysis.
Proficiency in programming languages such as C/C++, Python, or Java.
Strong knowledge of hardware and software integration for IoT devices.
Familiarity with cloud platforms and IoT protocols (e.g., MQTT, CoAP).
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Effective communication and teamwork skills.
If you are a passionate IoT Engineer with a drive to innovate and enhance products through the power of data and connectivity, we encourage you to apply. Join our team and help us shape the future of IoT technology and its applications.
About ZunRoof: ZunRoof is a home-tech company, powered by a mix of Image Processing, Virtual Reality, IOT and Data Analytics. They are solving energy issues of India by using un-utilized rooftops for solar, and by providing sense and control of every appliance in ones house through inhouse developed IoT-enabled hardware and accompanying apps. The company was founded in June 2016 by Pranesh Chaudhary and Sushant Sachan, both alumni of IIT- Kharagpur. In four years of starting up, ZunRoof has already become the #1 choice for residential and SME clients in India for solar. Till date, the company has assessed lakhs of homes, and has installed 15 MW+ of rooftop solar & 50,000+ IoT devices across 75+ cities in India.
To know more about us refer:
 https://www.zunroof.com/
 https://www.zunpulse.com/
https://www.zunsolar.com/
 https://zunpure.com/
Keywords: Embedded Software, Embedded C++, Embedded C, C++, Embedded Programming, Mqtt, Java, Python

Job Description:
Responsible for designing, developing, and implementing IoT systems and solutions that connect physical devices to the internet and enable them to communicate with each other and with the cloud. The job description of an IoT Engineer typically includes the following:
System Architecture: Designing and developing the system architecture for IoT solutions, including hardware and software components, communication protocols, and cloud infrastructure.
Hardware Design: Developing the hardware components of the IoT system, such as sensors, actuators, and microcontrollers, and integrating them with the software components.
Software Development: Developing the software components of the IoT system, such as firmware, middleware, and applications, and ensuring that they are secure, scalable, and reliable.
Data Management: Designing and implementing data management systems that can collect, store, and analyze the data generated by IoT devices.
Testing and Validation: Testing and validating the IoT system to ensure that it meets the requirements and specifications of the project.
Maintenance and Support: Providing maintenance and support services for the IoT system, including troubleshooting, bug fixing, and software updates.
Keywords: Estimator, HR
